xyz.fsgik.common.net.tcp

接口 FsTcpChannelHandler<M>

  • 类型参数:
    M - message type
    所有已知实现类:
    DelimiterBasedTcpChannelHandler, LengthBasedTcpChannelHandler

    public interface FsTcpChannelHandler<M>
    TCP/IP network channel callback handler.

    An implementation of FsTcpServer has a list of FsTcpChannelHandler.

    When the server receives new data from remote point, the data will be wrapped as ByteBuffer and passed to onMessage(FsTcpChannel, Object) of first handler. Returned object from first handler will be passed to next handler as message, and so on. If null is returned, the handlers calling chain will be broken; if an exception is thrown, FsTcpServerHandler.onException(FsTcpChannel, Throwable, ByteBuffer) will be called and the handlers calling chain will also be broken.

    onMessage(FsTcpChannel, Object) only be called when new data was received, for more detailed operations, try FsTcpServerHandler.onLoop(FsTcpChannel, boolean, ByteBuffer).

    If buffer of the channel is full, it will not read and put again. If the remaining data from the last callback has not been consumed, it will be left until the next callback.

    See the built-in handler implementations: LengthBasedTcpChannelHandler, DelimiterBasedTcpChannelHandler.

    另请参阅:
    LengthBasedTcpChannelHandler, DelimiterBasedTcpChannelHandler

    • 方法概要

      所有方法 实例方法 抽象方法 
      限定符和类型 方法和说明
      @Nullable java.lang.Object onMessage(FsTcpChannel channel, M message)
      Callback when new data has received.

    • 方法详细资料

      • onMessage

        @Nullable
@Nullable java.lang.Object onMessage(FsTcpChannel channel,
                                                M message)
        Callback when new data has received.

        Server has a list of handlers, the first handler will be passed a ByteBuffer as message parameter, then returned object from first handler will be passed to next handler as message parameter, and so on. If null is returned from any handler, the handlers calling chain will be broken at that handler; if an exception is thrown, FsTcpServerHandler.onException(FsTcpChannel, Throwable, ByteBuffer) will be called and the calling chain will also be broken. The process like: 

             Object message = ByteBuffer.wrap(...);
     for (FsNetChannelHandler<...> channelHandler : channelHandlers) {
         try {
             Object result = channelHandler.onMessage(channel, message);
             if (result == null) {
                 break;
             }
             message = result;
         } catch (Throwable e) {
             serverHandler.onException(channel, e, remaining);
             break;
         }
     }
        If buffer of the channel is full, it will not read and put again. If the buffer on this callback is not fully consumed (remaining() > 0), the remaining data will be reserved to next calling. However, the handler chain will be called if and only if there has new data read from the remote endpoint. It's best to try to consume as much as possible for each time, or using FsTcpServerHandler.onLoop(FsTcpChannel, boolean, ByteBuffer) to deal with un-consumed data.
        参数:
        channel - the channel
        message - the message
        返回:
        result of callback
